subject: Philosophy
title: Russell's Paradox
description: A fast breakdown of Russell's Paradox for builders.

hook.text: Consider the set of all sets that don't contain themselves. Does it contain itself?

buildup.text: If it does, then by definition it shouldn't. If it doesn't, then by definition it should. Contradiction.

discovery.text: Bertrand Russell discovered this in 1901. It shattered the foundations of set theory.

twist.text: Mathematics had to be rebuilt with new rules to prevent such self-referential sets from forming.

climax.text: Russell's paradox showed that even math â€” the most precise language we have â€” has hidden cracks.

punchline.text: Even logic can contradict itself if you look deep enough.

quiz.question: What did Russell's paradox reveal about set theory?
